nodes.body: Dullu, several miles west of Dailekh Bazaar in West Nepal, was the winter capital of the Khasa Malla kingdom. It contains Prithvimalla's pillar dated 1354 (first reported by Giuseppe Tucci in 1962) which provides a genealogy of the Khasa Malla dynasty, and a number of other stone structures from the 14th-15th centuries, including pillars, a throne, water tank with a Buddhist chaitya on top, as well as a 19th century royal palace.
nodes.title: Description of Dullu
